result.execSummary:
The defendant Dommont T Martin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders amounts to be paid during term of probation. Any unpaid amount to be converted to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessments.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Complete 25 hours of community service.
- Maintain full time employment or school.
- No Contact with Johnathan Williams.

timeConds.notes: Huber release for work and school (REPORT DATE: 11-03-15)

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA SENTENCING HEARING commencing OCTOBER 26, 2015 received and filed. (23 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to MICHAEL STEINLE.
Bail refund Check packet.
10/29/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.
- signed and filed with Office of the District Attorney Memorandum (undated).

Defendant Dommont T Martin in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms and body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Filed, Motion to Seal

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION WITH DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.

Defendant Dommont T Martin in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Dommont T Martin in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
